post_text:
Billionaire CEO Sridhar Vembu of Zoho Corporation is making sustainable commuting choices with his vehicle selection. He owns a Tata Nexon EV for longer city commutes and uses 2 Montra electric autorickshaws for journeys under 10 km. 

The Tata Nexon EV, India's best-selling electric vehicle from Tata Motors, boasts a 30.2kWh lithium-ion battery, offering a driving range of 312 km. On the other hand, the Montra electric auto, recognized with the International Red Dot Design Award, runs on a 10 kW lithium-ion battery with a range of 203 km.

By opting for electric vehicles like the Nexon EV and Montra e-autos, Sridhar Vembu is setting a practical and environmentally friendly example for sustainable transportation solutions.

üìå Finance & Consulting Insight | How Tata Motors Nexon Won India‚Äôs Market

Tata Nexon isn‚Äôt just a popular SUV. It‚Äôs a smart business strategy on wheels.
In a market filled with strong rivals, Nexon didn‚Äôt try to be the cheapest it focused on what really matters to Indian buyers.

üîç What Tata Did Right:
‚Ä¢ Made 5-star safety the hero feature ‚Üí families trust it more
‚Ä¢ Added premium features, but kept pricing friendly ‚Üí value for money
‚Ä¢ Offered Petrol, Diesel & EV options ‚Üí something for every customer
‚Ä¢ Used Tata‚Äôs trust + Make in India pride ‚Üí emotional connection

üìä Business & Finance Wins:
‚Ä¢ More sales = lower cost per car ‚Üí better profits
‚Ä¢ Different variants mean customers happily spend more ‚Üí higher revenue
‚Ä¢ Nexon EV gave Tata a head-start in the EV space
‚Ä¢ Faster selling cars ‚Üí cash comes back quickly, less money stuck in inventory

‚úÖ Strategic Takeaway:
Nexon shows that when a company understands what people care about safety, price, and trust success follows naturally.
Smart product decisions + emotional branding = long-term leadership.

Tata Motors Tata Group @tata
**Extremely Frustrated and Disappointed with Tata Motors ‚Äì Want Refund or Replacement**

I never expected to be writing something like this, but my experience with **Tata Motors** has been nothing short of shocking.

I bought a brand-new **Tata Nexon Creative+ PS Dark Edition Petrol DCT** just **1.5 months ago**. A brand-new car should give peace of mind ‚Äî instead, mine **refused to start right after the first service**.

And now the service centre tells me the **entire engine needs to be replaced**.
A full engine change in a month-old car? This is unbelievable and completely unacceptable.

What‚Äôs even more frustrating is that I emailed **Tata Motors North customer care**, and it‚Äôs been **over a week with ZERO response**. For a company of this scale, not even acknowledging a customer‚Äôs serious complaint is extremely disappointing.

I did not spend my hard-earned money on a brand-new car to deal with such major issues so soon. I‚Äôm not willing to accept an engine replacement on a car this new. I am demanding a **refund or a complete vehicle replacement**. This is clearly a manufacturing defect and I expect Tata Motors to take responsibility.

I genuinely believed in this brand, but this experience has completely shattered my trust. I hope Tata Motors steps up and resolves this urgently ‚Äî because no customer deserves this.
